Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Cyanide \Cy"a*nide\ (s?"?-n?d or -n?d; 104), n. [Cf. F. cyanide. See {Cyanic}.] (Chem.) A compound formed by the union of cyanogen with an element or radical. [1913 Webster]
cyanide n 1: any of a class of organic compounds containing the cyano radical -CN [syn: {nitrile}, {nitril}] 2: an extremely poisonous salt of hydrocyanic acid
